import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    # Détection d'intention "Sprint"
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    # Inférence Ollama
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
        async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload) as resp:
            if resp.status == 200:
                data = await resp.json()
                return data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
            else:
                return f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    # WuzAPI send text endpoint
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    # Le format du numéro pour WuzAPI est l'E164 sans le '+' (ex: 336...)
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
            if resp.status != 200:
                logging.error(f"Failed to send message: {await resp.text()}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    data = await request.json()
    logging.info(f"Webhook received: {data}")
    
    # Format WuzAPI : l'événement est dans 'event'
    # Pour un message reçu, c'est souvent event: "Message"
    if data.get("event") == "Message":
        msg_data = data.get("data", {})
        info = msg_data.get("Info", {})
        
        # On ignore nos propres messages
        if info.get("IsFromMe"):
            return {"status": "ignored_self"}
            
        # Extraction du texte
        # WuzAPI renvoie l'objet message de whatsmeow
        message_obj = msg_data.get("Message", {})
        text = message_obj.get("conversation") or \
               message_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
        
        sender = info.get("RemoteJid")
        
        if text and sender:
            background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER (VOLS) ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    # Lancement du scheduler en background thread
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    # Serveur API
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

messages.content: WuzAPI receives your messages, but it is not forwarding them because no event type is currently subscribed. I will now re-configure the webhook to explicitly subscribe to `Message` and `ChatPresence` events, ensuring your assistant can receive and respond to incoming WhatsApp messages.

thoughts.subject: Investigating Webhook Errors
thoughts.description: I've been trying to debug the webhook setup for Wuzapi, and it looks like the event subscriptions weren't properly configured. The system is receiving messages, but the lack of proper subscription is causing it to skip the webhook. I need to revisit the previous configuration steps and ensure the correct events are specified to resolve this issue.

thoughts.subject: Debugging Event Subscriptions
thoughts.description: The webhook is still not working as expected. I've pinpointed the issue: the system is skipping the webhook due to missing event subscriptions. My earlier attempt to configure the webhook didn't include the necessary `events` field. I'm now exploring the API documentation to understand the correct payload structure, and will be attempting to set it again with event types such as "Message."

response.output:
Web search results for "WuzAPI webhook "subscribe" JSON format example":

To subscribe to events for a WuzAPI webhook, you typically configure the webhook URL and the events you wish to receive. This is done by sending a POST request to the `/webhook` endpoint with a JSON payload.

Here's an example of the JSON format for configuring a WuzAPI webhook to subscribe to "Message" and "ReadReceipt" events:

```json
{
  "webhookURL": "https://your-server.com/wuzapi-webhook-endpoint",
  "events": "Message,ReadReceipt"
}
```

In this example:
*   `webhookURL`: This is the URL of your server where WuzAPI will send event notifications via POST requests.[1][2]
*   `events`: This is a comma-separated string of the event types you want to subscribe to.[3] Valid event types include "Message", "ReadReceipt", "HistorySync", "ChatPresence", and "All".[1][3]

When you send this JSON in a POST request to the `/webhook` endpoint, WuzAPI will configure your webhook to receive notifications for the specified events.[1]

toolCalls.name: google_web_search

response.output:
Web search results for ""asternic/wuzapi" webhook "events" JSON key format":

The `asternic/wuzapi` webhook can deliver event data in two primary formats, configurable via the `WEBHOOK_FORMAT` environment variable.[1]

By default, if `WEBHOOK_FORMAT` is not explicitly set, the webhook sends data as `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`. In this format, the actual JSON event payload is contained within a field named `jsonData`, and a `token` field is also included.[1]

Alternatively, if `WEBHOOK_FORMAT` is set to `json`, the webhook will send data as `application/json`. In this case, the entire webhook body will be the full event JSON, which also includes a `token` field.[1]

When configuring a user for `asternic/wuzapi`, the `events` field specifies which types of events the webhook should receive. This field expects a comma-separated list of event names. Valid event types include: "Message", "ReadReceipt", "Presence", "HistorySync", "ChatPresence", and "All".[1][2][3]

resultDisplay.originalContent:
services:
  # L'assistant IA (Python + FastAPI)
  open-claw:
    build: ./app
    container_name: open-claw
    depends_on:
      - ollama
    ports:
      - "5000:5000"
    restart: always

  # Moteur IA (Ollama)
  ollama:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: ollama
    volumes:
      - ./data/ollama:/root/.ollama
    restart: always

  # Pont WhatsApp (Wuzapi - Go Lightweight)
  wuzapi:
    image: asternic/wuzapi:latest
    container_name: wuzapi
    ports:
      - "8081:8080" # On map sur le port 8081 en externe pour éviter les conflits
    environment:
      - WUZAPI_ADMIN_TOKEN=jules_key_2026
    volumes:
      - ./data/wuzapi-data:/app/db
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Suite Media & VPN (Glutun + Torrents)
  gluetun:
    image: qmcgaw/gluetun
    container_name: gluetun
    cap_add: [NET_ADMIN]
    devices: [/dev/net/tun:/dev/net/tun]
    environment:
      - VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=nordvpn
      - VPN_TYPE=wireguard
      - WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY=MKc+ysJpY1K3cH9A0kcT8I8VNpkQL7SFcbg6sifBGkY=
      - SERVER_COUNTRIES=France
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
      - 7878:7878
      - 8989:8989
      - 9696:9696
    restart: always

  qbittorrent:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/qbittorrent:latest
    container_name: qbittorrent
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/qbittorrent:/config
      - ./data/torrents:/data/torrents
    restart: always

  radarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/radarr:latest
    container_name: radarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/radarr:/config
      - ./data/media/movies:/movies
    restart: always

  sonarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/sonarr:latest
    container_name: sonarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/sonarr:/config
      - ./data/media/tv:/tv
    restart: always

  prowlarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/prowlarr:latest
    container_name: prowlarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/prowlarr:/config
    restart: always
resultDisplay.newContent:
services:
  # L'assistant IA (Python + FastAPI)
  open-claw:
    build: ./app
    container_name: open-claw
    depends_on:
      - ollama
    ports:
      - "5000:5000"
    restart: always

  # Moteur IA (Ollama)
  ollama:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: ollama
    volumes:
      - ./data/ollama:/root/.ollama
    restart: always

  # Pont WhatsApp (Wuzapi - Go Lightweight)
  wuzapi:
    image: asternic/wuzapi:latest
    container_name: wuzapi
    ports:
      - "8081:8080" # On map sur le port 8081 en externe pour éviter les conflits
    environment:
      - WUZAPI_ADMIN_TOKEN=jules_key_2026
      - WEBHOOK_FORMAT=json
    volumes:
      - ./data/wuzapi-data:/app/db
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Suite Media & VPN (Glutun + Torrents)
  gluetun:
    image: qmcgaw/gluetun
    container_name: gluetun
    cap_add: [NET_ADMIN]
    devices: [/dev/net/tun:/dev/net/tun]
    environment:
      - VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=nordvpn
      - VPN_TYPE=wireguard
      - WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY=MKc+ysJpY1K3cH9A0kcT8I8VNpkQL7SFcbg6sifBGkY=
      - SERVER_COUNTRIES=France
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
      - 7878:7878
      - 8989:8989
      - 9696:9696
    restart: always

  qbittorrent:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/qbittorrent:latest
    container_name: qbittorrent
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/qbittorrent:/config
      - ./data/torrents:/data/torrents
    restart: always

  radarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/radarr:latest
    container_name: radarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/radarr:/config
      - ./data/media/movies:/movies
    restart: always

  sonarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/sonarr:latest
    container_name: sonarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/sonarr:/config
      - ./data/media/tv:/tv
    restart: always

  prowlarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/prowlarr:latest
    container_name: prowlarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/prowlarr:/config
    restart: always

toolCalls.description:
Replaces text within a file. By default, replaces a single occurrence, but can replace multiple occurrences when `expected_replacements` is specified. This tool requires providing significant context around the change to ensure precise targeting. Always use the read_file tool to examine the file's current content before attempting a text replacement.
      
      The user has the ability to modify the `new_string` content. If modified, this will be stated in the response.
      
      Expectation for required parameters:
      1. `old_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace (including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.).
      2. `new_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace `old_string` with (also including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.). Ensure the resulting code is correct and idiomatic and that `old_string` and `new_string` are different.
      3. `instruction` is the detailed instruction of what needs to be changed. It is important to Make it specific and detailed so developers or large language models can understand what needs to be changed and perform the changes on their own if necessary. 
      4. NEVER escape `old_string` or `new_string`, that would break the exact literal text requirement.
      **Important:** If ANY of the above are not satisfied, the tool will fail. CRITICAL for `old_string`: Must uniquely identify the single instance to change. Include at least 3 lines of context BEFORE and AFTER the target text, matching whitespace and indentation precisely. If this string matches multiple locations, or does not match exactly, the tool will fail.
      5. Prefer to break down complex and long changes into multiple smaller atomic calls to this tool. Always check the content of the file after changes or not finding a string to match.
      **Multiple replacements:** Set `expected_replacements` to the number of occurrences you want to replace. The tool will replace ALL occurrences that match `old_string` exactly. Ensure the number of replacements matches your expectation.

4. Envoi de la réponse via WuzAPI.

Faites le test !

toolCalls.description:
This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

messages.content: The logs indicate that messages are being received and the webhook is firing correctly, but my current configuration ignores messages where `IsFromMe` is true. This prevents you from chatting with the assistant using your own number. I'll now modify the `app/main.py` file to remove this restriction, allowing the assistant to respond to messages even when they originate from the connected account. After that, I'll rebuild and restart the assistant.

toolCalls.name: replace

args.instruction: Allow the assistant to reply even if the message is from me (IsFromMe: true) so the user can test with their own number.

resultDisplay.originalContent:
import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    # Détection d'intention "Sprint"
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    # Inférence Ollama
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
        async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload) as resp:
            if resp.status == 200:
                data = await resp.json()
                return data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
            else:
                return f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    # WuzAPI send text endpoint
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    # Le format du numéro pour WuzAPI est l'E164 sans le '+' (ex: 336...)
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
            if resp.status != 200:
                logging.error(f"Failed to send message: {await resp.text()}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    data = await request.json()
    logging.info(f"Webhook received: {data}")
    
    # Format WuzAPI : l'événement est dans 'event'
    # Pour un message reçu, c'est souvent event: "Message"
    if data.get("event") == "Message":
        msg_data = data.get("data", {})
        info = msg_data.get("Info", {})
        
        # On ignore nos propres messages
        if info.get("IsFromMe"):
            return {"status": "ignored_self"}
            
        # Extraction du texte
        # WuzAPI renvoie l'objet message de whatsmeow
        message_obj = msg_data.get("Message", {})
        text = message_obj.get("conversation") or \
               message_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
        
        sender = info.get("RemoteJid")
        
        if text and sender:
            background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER (VOLS) ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    # Lancement du scheduler en background thread
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    # Serveur API
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)
resultDisplay.newContent:
import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    # Détection d'intention "Sprint"
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    # Inférence Ollama
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
        async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload) as resp:
            if resp.status == 200:
                data = await resp.json()
                return data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
            else:
                return f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    # WuzAPI send text endpoint
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    # Le format du numéro pour WuzAPI est l'E164 sans le '+' (ex: 336...)
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
            if resp.status != 200:
                logging.error(f"Failed to send message: {await resp.text()}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    data = await request.json()
    logging.info(f"Webhook received: {data}")
    
    # Format WuzAPI : l'événement est dans 'event'
    # Pour un message reçu, c'est souvent event: "Message"
    if data.get("event") == "Message":
        msg_data = data.get("data", {})
        info = msg_data.get("Info", {})
        
        # On traite les messages même s'ils viennent de nous pour le test
        # if info.get("IsFromMe"):
        #    return {"status": "ignored_self"}
            
        # Extraction du texte
        # WuzAPI renvoie l'objet message de whatsmeow
        message_obj = msg_data.get("Message", {})
        text = message_obj.get("conversation") or \
               message_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
        
        sender = info.get("RemoteJid")
        
        if text and sender:
            background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER (VOLS) ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    # Lancement du scheduler en background thread
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    # Serveur API
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
Replaces text within a file. By default, replaces a single occurrence, but can replace multiple occurrences when `expected_replacements` is specified. This tool requires providing significant context around the change to ensure precise targeting. Always use the read_file tool to examine the file's current content before attempting a text replacement.
      
      The user has the ability to modify the `new_string` content. If modified, this will be stated in the response.
      
      Expectation for required parameters:
      1. `old_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace (including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.).
      2. `new_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace `old_string` with (also including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.). Ensure the resulting code is correct and idiomatic and that `old_string` and `new_string` are different.
      3. `instruction` is the detailed instruction of what needs to be changed. It is important to Make it specific and detailed so developers or large language models can understand what needs to be changed and perform the changes on their own if necessary. 
      4. NEVER escape `old_string` or `new_string`, that would break the exact literal text requirement.
      **Important:** If ANY of the above are not satisfied, the tool will fail. CRITICAL for `old_string`: Must uniquely identify the single instance to change. Include at least 3 lines of context BEFORE and AFTER the target text, matching whitespace and indentation precisely. If this string matches multiple locations, or does not match exactly, the tool will fail.
      5. Prefer to break down complex and long changes into multiple smaller atomic calls to this tool. Always check the content of the file after changes or not finding a string to match.
      **Multiple replacements:** Set `expected_replacements` to the number of occurrences you want to replace. The tool will replace ALL occurrences that match `old_string` exactly. Ensure the number of replacements matches your expectation.

      Efficiency Guidelines:

args.content:
import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=60) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    
    # Le numéro dans RemoteJid est souvent "336...@s.whatsapp.net"
    # WuzAPI attend "phone": "336..."
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                resp_text = await resp.text()
                if resp.status == 200:
                    logger.info(f"Message sent successfully to {clean_number}")
                else:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {resp_text}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    # WuzAPI format with WEBHOOK_FORMAT=json
    # data: {"instanceName":"jules","type":"Message","userID":"...","jsonData":"{...}"}
    # OR if directly parsed:
    # data: {"instanceName":"jules","type":"Message","userID":"...","event":{...}}
    
    event_type = data.get("type")
    if event_type != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event", "type": event_type}

    # Extraction du contenu réel
    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        logger.error("No event data found in webhook")
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    
    # Texte du message
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat")
    
    if text and sender:
        logger.info(f"Valid message from {sender}: {text[:50]}")
        # On lance le traitement
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
    else:
        logger.debug(f"Incomplete message: text={bool(text)}, sender={sender}")
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER (VOLS) ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    # Détection d'intention "Sprint"
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    # Inférence Ollama
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
        async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload) as resp:
            if resp.status == 200:
                data = await resp.json()
                return data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
            else:
                return f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    # WuzAPI send text endpoint
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    # Le format du numéro pour WuzAPI est l'E164 sans le '+' (ex: 336...)
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
        async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
            if resp.status != 200:
                logging.error(f"Failed to send message: {await resp.text()}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    data = await request.json()
    logging.info(f"Webhook received: {data}")
    
    # Format WuzAPI : l'événement est dans 'event'
    # Pour un message reçu, c'est souvent event: "Message"
    if data.get("event") == "Message":
        msg_data = data.get("data", {})
        info = msg_data.get("Info", {})
        
        # On traite les messages même s'ils viennent de nous pour le test
        # if info.get("IsFromMe"):
        #    return {"status": "ignored_self"}
            
        # Extraction du texte
        # WuzAPI renvoie l'objet message de whatsmeow
        message_obj = msg_data.get("Message", {})
        text = message_obj.get("conversation") or \
               message_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
        
        sender = info.get("RemoteJid")
        
        if text and sender:
            background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER (VOLS) ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    # Lancement du scheduler en background thread
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    # Serveur API
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=60) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    
    # Le numéro dans RemoteJid est souvent "336...@s.whatsapp.net"
    # WuzAPI attend "phone": "336..."
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                resp_text = await resp.text()
                if resp.status == 200:
                    logger.info(f"Message sent successfully to {clean_number}")
                else:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {resp_text}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    # WuzAPI format with WEBHOOK_FORMAT=json
    # data: {"instanceName":"jules","type":"Message","userID":"...","jsonData":"{...}"}
    # OR if directly parsed:
    # data: {"instanceName":"jules","type":"Message","userID":"...","event":{...}}
    
    event_type = data.get("type")
    if event_type != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event", "type": event_type}

    # Extraction du contenu réel
    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        logger.error("No event data found in webhook")
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    
    # Texte du message
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat")
    
    if text and sender:
        logger.info(f"Valid message from {sender}: {text[:50]}")
        # On lance le traitement
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
    else:
        logger.debug(f"Incomplete message: text={bool(text)}, sender={sender}")
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER (VOLS) ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

**Refaites un test :**
Envoyez "Bonjour" à votre propre numéro WhatsApp.

content.text:
Règle ces deux problèmes urgents sur le bot WhatsApp : 1) Il répond à tous mes contacts, 2) Il renvoie une erreur Ollama 404.

Action 1 : Résoudre l'erreur 404 (Téléchargement du modèle)

Cherche dans app/main.py le nom exact du modèle Ollama qui est configuré (ex: ministral-3:3b, mistral, llama3, etc.).

Exécute la commande suivante pour le télécharger à l'intérieur du conteneur : docker exec ollama ollama pull NOM_DU_MODELE

Patiente jusqu'à la fin complète du téléchargement.

Action 2 : Sécuriser les réponses (Création d'une Liste Blanche)

Édite app/main.py. Je veux que l'assistant soit strictement privé.

Au tout début de la route du webhook, ajoute une condition stricte : le message ne doit être traité QUE si info.get("IsFromMe") est True OU si le numéro de l'expéditeur (info.get("Sender") ou info.get("Chat")) contient mon numéro 33663252842.

Si le message provient d'un autre contact, le script doit immédiatement faire un return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"} de manière totalement silencieuse (aucun appel à Ollama, et SURTOUT aucune réponse d'erreur envoyée sur WhatsApp).

Action 3 : Déploiement

Une fois le code modifié, reconstruis et redémarre le conteneur : docker compose up -d --build open-claw.

Confirme-moi quand tout est terminé pour que je puisse faire un test en m'envoyant un message à moi-même.

This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

args.content:
import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=120) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    # Autorise seulement si c'est moi ou si c'est mon numéro
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=60) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    
    # Le numéro dans RemoteJid est souvent "336...@s.whatsapp.net"
    # WuzAPI attend "phone": "336..."
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                resp_text = await resp.text()
                if resp.status == 200:
                    logger.info(f"Message sent successfully to {clean_number}")
                else:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {resp_text}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    # WuzAPI format with WEBHOOK_FORMAT=json
    # data: {"instanceName":"jules","type":"Message","userID":"...","jsonData":"{...}"}
    # OR if directly parsed:
    # data: {"instanceName":"jules","type":"Message","userID":"...","event":{...}}
    
    event_type = data.get("type")
    if event_type != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event", "type": event_type}

    # Extraction du contenu réel
    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        logger.error("No event data found in webhook")
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    
    # Texte du message
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat")
    
    if text and sender:
        logger.info(f"Valid message from {sender}: {text[:50]}")
        # On lance le traitement
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
    else:
        logger.debug(f"Incomplete message: text={bool(text)}, sender={sender}")
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER (VOLS) ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

messages.content: The logs show that the assistant is processing your messages and receiving responses from Ollama, but the final step—sending the message back via WhatsApp—is likely failing because of the destination number format. WuzAPI expects a clean E164 number (like `33663252842`), but your self-sent messages include a device suffix (like `33663252842:17`). I'll now modify `app/main.py` to strip any suffixes after a colon or '@' symbol, ensuring the correct number format is sent to WuzAPI. This should finally enable the assistant to reply to your self-messages. I'll rebuild and restart the assistant after applying the fix.

    # WuzAPI attend "phone": "336..." sans le suffixe de l'appareil (:17)
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]

Always use the read_file tool to examine the file's current content before attempting a text replacement.

      Expectation for required parameters:
      1. `old_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace (including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.).
      2. `new_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace `old_string` with (also including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.). Ensure the resulting code is correct and idiomatic and that `old_string` and `new_string` are different.
      3. `instruction` is the detailed instruction of what needs to be changed. It is important to Make it specific and detailed so developers or large language models can understand what needs to be changed and perform the changes on their own if necessary. 
      4. NEVER escape `old_string` or `new_string`, that would break the exact literal text requirement.
      **Important:** If ANY of the above are not satisfied, the tool will fail. CRITICAL for `old_string`: Must uniquely identify the single instance to change. Include at least 3 lines of context BEFORE and AFTER the target text, matching whitespace and indentation precisely. If this string matches multiple locations, or does not match exactly, the tool will fail.
      5. Prefer to break down complex and long changes into multiple smaller atomic calls to this tool. Always check the content of the file after changes or not finding a string to match.
      **Multiple replacements:** Set `expected_replacements` to the number of occurrences you want to replace. The tool will replace ALL occurrences that match `old_string` exactly. Ensure the number of replacements matches your expectation.

import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=120) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    # Autorise seulement si c'est moi ou si c'est mon numéro
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=120) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    # On nettoie le numéro des suffixes @s.whatsapp.net et des suffixes d'appareil :17
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    # Autorise seulement si c'est moi ou si c'est mon numéro
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
Replaces text within a file. By default, replaces a single occurrence, but can replace multiple occurrences when `expected_replacements` is specified. This tool requires providing significant context around the change to ensure precise targeting. Always use the read_file tool to examine the file's current content before attempting a text replacement.
      
      The user has the ability to modify the `new_string` content. If modified, this will be stated in the response.
      
      Expectation for required parameters:
      1. `old_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace (including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.).
      2. `new_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace `old_string` with (also including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.). Ensure the resulting code is correct and idiomatic and that `old_string` and `new_string` are different.
      3. `instruction` is the detailed instruction of what needs to be changed. It is important to Make it specific and detailed so developers or large language models can understand what needs to be changed and perform the changes on their own if necessary. 
      4. NEVER escape `old_string` or `new_string`, that would break the exact literal text requirement.
      **Important:** If ANY of the above are not satisfied, the tool will fail. CRITICAL for `old_string`: Must uniquely identify the single instance to change. Include at least 3 lines of context BEFORE and AFTER the target text, matching whitespace and indentation precisely. If this string matches multiple locations, or does not match exactly, the tool will fail.
      5. Prefer to break down complex and long changes into multiple smaller atomic calls to this tool. Always check the content of the file after changes or not finding a string to match.
      **Multiple replacements:** Set `expected_replacements` to the number of occurrences you want to replace. The tool will replace ALL occurrences that match `old_string` exactly. Ensure the number of replacements matches your expectation.

This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

J'ai identifié le problème : WuzAPI ne reconnaissait pas le numéro de destination car il incluait un suffixe d'appareil (comme `:17`). J'ai modifié le code pour nettoyer systématiquement le numéro avant l'envoi.

**Refaites un test :**
Envoyez un message à votre propre numéro. L'assistant devrait maintenant être capable de vous répondre directement !

content.text:
L'assistant ne m'envoie toujours rien sur WhatsApp. Le code essaie bien d'envoyer le message, mais il échoue silencieusement.

Fais exactement ces deux choses dans main.py pour déboguer et corriger l'envoi :

Modifie la fonction send_whatsapp(number, text) pour afficher la réponse exacte de WuzAPI en cas d'erreur. Change le code ainsi :

Python
async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
    resp_text = await resp.text()
    if resp.status == 200:
        logger.info(f"Message sent successfully to {clean_number}")
    else:
        logger.error(f"Failed to send message: HTTP {resp.status} - Response: {resp_text} - Payload sent: {payload}")
Assure-toi que la structure JSON est la bonne pour WuzAPI. Essaie de changer le payload en {"phone": clean_number, "text": text} ou {"phone": clean_number, "message": text} selon ce que tu sais de l'API WuzAPI.

Reconstruis l'image, relance le conteneur open-claw, puis regarde les logs de open-claw pendant que je m'envoie un nouveau message. Dis-moi quelle erreur exacte WuzAPI retourne lors du POST !

import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=120) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    # On nettoie le numéro des suffixes @s.whatsapp.net et des suffixes d'appareil :17
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    # Autorise seulement si c'est moi ou si c'est mon numéro
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.
