resultDisplay.originalContent:
import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=120) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    
    # On nettoie le numéro des suffixes @s.whatsapp.net et des suffixes d'appareil :17
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    
    # On essaie 'text' au lieu de 'body' car c'est plus standard dans WuzAPI
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "text": text}
    logger.info(f"Attempting to send WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                resp_text = await resp.text()
                if resp.status == 200:
                    logger.info(f"✅ Message sent successfully to {clean_number}")
                else:
                    logger.error(f"❌ Failed to send message: HTTP {resp.status} - Response: {resp_text} - Payload sent: {payload}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"❌ Exception during WhatsApp send: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    # Autorise seulement si c'est moi ou si c'est mon numéro
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

messages.content:
C'est fait ! Je suis revenu à la version précédente avec le champ `body` et les logs standards. 

Tout est maintenant en place et opérationnel. Votre assistant WhatsApp est prêt à répondre !

content.text:
"Changement de stratégie : nous allons conserver le conteneur ollama dans le docker-compose.yml (il nous servira plus tard pour traiter des données sensibles en local). En revanche, pour la messagerie WhatsApp courante, je veux que l'assistant utilise l'API d'OpenAI avec le modèle gpt-4o-mini afin d'avoir des réponses quasi-instantanées.

Fais exactement ces actions :

1. Mise à jour de docker-compose.yml :



Ne touche pas au service ollama.

Sous le service open-claw, ajoute la variable d'environnement OPENAI_API_KEY= "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"

2. Modification de app/main.py :



Ajoute l'import import os si ce n'est pas fait, et récupère la clé avec OPENAI_API_KEY = os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY").

Modifie la fonction qui interroge l'IA (sûrement process_ai_logic). Au lieu de faire un POST vers OLLAMA_URL, fais un appel asynchrone avec aiohttp vers https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions.

Configure les headers ainsi : headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {OPENAI_API_KEY}", "Content-Type": "application/json"}

Configure le payload ainsi : payload = {"model": "gpt-4o-mini", "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]}

Modifie le code d'extraction pour récupérer la réponse OpenAI : response_text = data["choices"][0]["message"]["content"].

Gère les erreurs (Timeout, erreur HTTP 401, etc.) pour qu'elles s'affichent proprement dans les logs.

thoughts.subject: Evaluating the Backend Shift
thoughts.description: I'm currently focused on refactoring the backend. My primary aim is to transition from the local Ollama setup to OpenAI's GPT-4o-mini for speedier WhatsApp responses. Simultaneously, I intend to retain the Ollama container for potential future utilization. I'm starting by modifying the `docker-compose.yml` configuration.

Next, I plan to move on to modifying `app/main.py` and the required imports for `os` and retrieving the key. After that, I will define the OpenAI call and refine response extraction.

resultDisplay.originalContent:
services:
  # L'assistant IA (Python + FastAPI)
  open-claw:
    build: ./app
    container_name: open-claw
    depends_on:
      - ollama
    ports:
      - "5000:5000"
    restart: always

  # Moteur IA (Ollama)
  ollama:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: ollama
    volumes:
      - ./data/ollama:/root/.ollama
    restart: always

  # Pont WhatsApp (Wuzapi - Go Lightweight)
  wuzapi:
    image: asternic/wuzapi:latest
    container_name: wuzapi
    ports:
      - "8081:8080" # On map sur le port 8081 en externe pour éviter les conflits
    environment:
      - WUZAPI_ADMIN_TOKEN=jules_key_2026
      - WEBHOOK_FORMAT=json
    volumes:
      - ./data/wuzapi-data:/app/db
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Suite Media & VPN (Glutun + Torrents)
  gluetun:
    image: qmcgaw/gluetun
    container_name: gluetun
    cap_add: [NET_ADMIN]
    devices: [/dev/net/tun:/dev/net/tun]
    environment:
      - VPN_SERVICE_PROVIDER=nordvpn
      - VPN_TYPE=wireguard
      - WIREGUARD_PRIVATE_KEY=MKc+ysJpY1K3cH9A0kcT8I8VNpkQL7SFcbg6sifBGkY=
      - SERVER_COUNTRIES=France
    ports:
      - 8080:8080
      - 7878:7878
      - 8989:8989
      - 9696:9696
    restart: always

  qbittorrent:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/qbittorrent:latest
    container_name: qbittorrent
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/qbittorrent:/config
      - ./data/torrents:/data/torrents
    restart: always

  radarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/radarr:latest
    container_name: radarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/radarr:/config
      - ./data/media/movies:/movies
    restart: always

  sonarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/sonarr:latest
    container_name: sonarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/sonarr:/config
      - ./data/media/tv:/tv
    restart: always

  prowlarr:
    image: lscr.io/linuxserver/prowlarr:latest
    container_name: prowlarr
    network_mode: "service:gluetun"
    volumes:
      - ./config/prowlarr:/config
    restart: always

toolCalls.description:
Replaces text within a file. By default, replaces a single occurrence, but can replace multiple occurrences when `expected_replacements` is specified. This tool requires providing significant context around the change to ensure precise targeting. Always use the read_file tool to examine the file's current content before attempting a text replacement.
      
      The user has the ability to modify the `new_string` content. If modified, this will be stated in the response.
      
      Expectation for required parameters:
      1. `old_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace (including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.).
      2. `new_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace `old_string` with (also including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.). Ensure the resulting code is correct and idiomatic and that `old_string` and `new_string` are different.
      3. `instruction` is the detailed instruction of what needs to be changed. It is important to Make it specific and detailed so developers or large language models can understand what needs to be changed and perform the changes on their own if necessary. 
      4. NEVER escape `old_string` or `new_string`, that would break the exact literal text requirement.
      **Important:** If ANY of the above are not satisfied, the tool will fail. CRITICAL for `old_string`: Must uniquely identify the single instance to change. Include at least 3 lines of context BEFORE and AFTER the target text, matching whitespace and indentation precisely. If this string matches multiple locations, or does not match exactly, the tool will fail.
      5. Prefer to break down complex and long changes into multiple smaller atomic calls to this tool. Always check the content of the file after changes or not finding a string to match.
      **Multiple replacements:** Set `expected_replacements` to the number of occurrences you want to replace. The tool will replace ALL occurrences that match `old_string` exactly. Ensure the number of replacements matches your expectation.

response.output:
import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=120) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    
    # On nettoie le numéro des suffixes @s.whatsapp.net et des suffixes d'appareil :17
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    # Autorise seulement si c'est moi ou si c'est mon numéro
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description: Reads and returns the content of a specified file. If the file is large, the content will be truncated. The tool's response will clearly indicate if truncation has occurred and will provide details on how to read more of the file using the 'offset' and 'limit' parameters. Handles text, images (PNG, JPG, GIF, WEBP, SVG, BMP), audio files (MP3, WAV, AIFF, AAC, OGG, FLAC), and PDF files. For text files, it can read specific line ranges.

resultDisplay.originalContent:
import asyncio
import logging
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OLLAMA_URL = "http://ollama:11434/api/generate"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
MODEL = "ministral-3:3b"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    try:
        r = requests.get(search_url, timeout=10).json()
        if r and isinstance(r, list):
            movie = r[0]
            payload = {
                "title": movie['title'], "qualityProfileId": 1, "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                "images": movie['images'], "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], "year": movie['year'],
                "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", "monitored": True, "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
            }
            requests.post(f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}", json=payload, timeout=10)
            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
    except Exception as e: return f"❌ Erreur Radarr : {e}"
    return "❌ Film non trouvé."

# --- LOGIQUE IA ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to Ollama: {prompt[:50]}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            payload = {"model": MODEL, "prompt": prompt, "stream": False}
            async with session.post(OLLAMA_URL, json=payload, timeout=120) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data.get("response", "IA indisponible.")
                    logger.info("Ollama response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_msg = f"❌ Erreur Ollama : {resp.status}"
                    logger.error(err_msg)
                    return err_msg
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Ollama connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion Ollama : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    
    # On nettoie le numéro des suffixes @s.whatsapp.net et des suffixes d'appareil :17
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    # Autorise seulement si c'est moi ou si c'est mon numéro
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

args.content:
import asyncio
import logging
import os
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OPENAI_API_KEY = os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY")
OPENAI_URL = "https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
async def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    logger.info(f"Searching for movie: {title}")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.get(search_url, timeout=15) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    error_text = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr HTTP {resp.status} : {error_text}")
                    return f"Erreur de communication avec Radarr (Code {resp.status})."
                
                results = await resp.json()
                if results and isinstance(results, list):
                    movie = results[0]
                    payload = {
                        "title": movie['title'], 
                        "qualityProfileId": 1, 
                        "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                        "images": movie['images'], 
                        "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], 
                        "year": movie['year'],
                        "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", 
                        "monitored": True, 
                        "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
                    }
                    
                    add_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
                    async with session.post(add_url, json=payload, timeout=15) as post_resp:
                        if post_resp.status in [200, 201]:
                            logger.info(f"✅ Movie '{movie['title']}' added successfully.")
                            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
                        else:
                            post_err = await post_resp.text()
                            logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr POST {post_resp.status} : {post_err}")
                            return f"Erreur lors de l'ajout à Radarr (Code {post_resp.status})."
                
                return "❌ Film non trouvé."
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"❌ Exception Radarr : {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur technique Radarr : {e}"

# --- LOGIQUE IA (OpenAI) ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return await add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to OpenAI: {prompt[:50]}...")
    
    if not OPENAI_API_KEY:
        logger.error("OPENAI_API_KEY is not set.")
        return "❌ Erreur : Clé API OpenAI manquante."

    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {OPENAI_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }
    
    payload = {
        "model": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
    }

    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(OPENAI_URL, json=payload, headers=headers, timeout=30) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data["choices"][0]["message"]["content"]
                    logger.info("OpenAI response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_body = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"OpenAI error {resp.status}: {err_body}")
                    return f"❌ Erreur OpenAI : {resp.status}"
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"OpenAI connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion OpenAI : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

resultDisplay.newContent:
import asyncio
import logging
import os
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OPENAI_API_KEY = os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY")
OPENAI_URL = "https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
async def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    logger.info(f"Searching for movie: {title}")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.get(search_url, timeout=15) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    error_text = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr HTTP {resp.status} : {error_text}")
                    return f"Erreur de communication avec Radarr (Code {resp.status})."
                
                results = await resp.json()
                if results and isinstance(results, list):
                    movie = results[0]
                    payload = {
                        "title": movie['title'], 
                        "qualityProfileId": 1, 
                        "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                        "images": movie['images'], 
                        "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], 
                        "year": movie['year'],
                        "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", 
                        "monitored": True, 
                        "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
                    }
                    
                    add_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
                    async with session.post(add_url, json=payload, timeout=15) as post_resp:
                        if post_resp.status in [200, 201]:
                            logger.info(f"✅ Movie '{movie['title']}' added successfully.")
                            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
                        else:
                            post_err = await post_resp.text()
                            logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr POST {post_resp.status} : {post_err}")
                            return f"Erreur lors de l'ajout à Radarr (Code {post_resp.status})."
                
                return "❌ Film non trouvé."
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"❌ Exception Radarr : {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur technique Radarr : {e}"

# --- LOGIQUE IA (OpenAI) ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return await add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to OpenAI: {prompt[:50]}...")
    
    if not OPENAI_API_KEY:
        logger.error("OPENAI_API_KEY is not set.")
        return "❌ Erreur : Clé API OpenAI manquante."

    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {OPENAI_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }
    
    payload = {
        "model": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
    }

    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(OPENAI_URL, json=payload, headers=headers, timeout=30) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data["choices"][0]["message"]["content"]
                    logger.info("OpenAI response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_body = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"OpenAI error {resp.status}: {err_body}")
                    return f"❌ Erreur OpenAI : {resp.status}"
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"OpenAI connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion OpenAI : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

import asyncio
import logging
import os
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OPENAI_API_KEY = os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY")
OPENAI_URL = "https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
async def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    logger.info(f"Searching for movie: {title}")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.get(search_url, timeout=15) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    error_text = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr HTTP {resp.status} : {error_text}")
                    return f"Erreur de communication avec Radarr (Code {resp.status})."
                
                results = await resp.json()
                if results and isinstance(results, list):
                    movie = results[0]
                    payload = {
                        "title": movie['title'], 
                        "qualityProfileId": 1, 
                        "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                        "images": movie['images'], 
                        "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], 
                        "year": movie['year'],
                        "rootFolderPath": "/movies/", 
                        "monitored": True, 
                        "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
                    }
                    
                    add_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
                    async with session.post(add_url, json=payload, timeout=15) as post_resp:
                        if post_resp.status in [200, 201]:
                            logger.info(f"✅ Movie '{movie['title']}' added successfully.")
                            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
                        else:
                            post_err = await post_resp.text()
                            logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr POST {post_resp.status} : {post_err}")
                            return f"Erreur lors de l'ajout à Radarr (Code {post_resp.status})."
                
                return "❌ Film non trouvé."
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"❌ Exception Radarr : {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur technique Radarr : {e}"

# --- LOGIQUE IA (OpenAI) ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return await add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to OpenAI: {prompt[:50]}...")
    
    if not OPENAI_API_KEY:
        logger.error("OPENAI_API_KEY is not set.")
        return "❌ Erreur : Clé API OpenAI manquante."

    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {OPENAI_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }
    
    payload = {
        "model": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
    }

    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(OPENAI_URL, json=payload, headers=headers, timeout=30) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data["choices"][0]["message"]["content"]
                    logger.info("OpenAI response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_body = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"OpenAI error {resp.status}: {err_body}")
                    return f"❌ Erreur OpenAI : {resp.status}"
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"OpenAI connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion OpenAI : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
Replaces text within a file. By default, replaces a single occurrence, but can replace multiple occurrences when `expected_replacements` is specified. This tool requires providing significant context around the change to ensure precise targeting. Always use the read_file tool to examine the file's current content before attempting a text replacement.
      
      The user has the ability to modify the `new_string` content. If modified, this will be stated in the response.
      
      Expectation for required parameters:
      1. `old_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace (including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.).
      2. `new_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace `old_string` with (also including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.). Ensure the resulting code is correct and idiomatic and that `old_string` and `new_string` are different.
      3. `instruction` is the detailed instruction of what needs to be changed. It is important to Make it specific and detailed so developers or large language models can understand what needs to be changed and perform the changes on their own if necessary. 
      4. NEVER escape `old_string` or `new_string`, that would break the exact literal text requirement.
      **Important:** If ANY of the above are not satisfied, the tool will fail. CRITICAL for `old_string`: Must uniquely identify the single instance to change. Include at least 3 lines of context BEFORE and AFTER the target text, matching whitespace and indentation precisely. If this string matches multiple locations, or does not match exactly, the tool will fail.
      5. Prefer to break down complex and long changes into multiple smaller atomic calls to this tool. Always check the content of the file after changes or not finding a string to match.
      **Multiple replacements:** Set `expected_replacements` to the number of occurrences you want to replace. The tool will replace ALL occurrences that match `old_string` exactly. Ensure the number of replacements matches your expectation.

J'ai corrigé les deux problèmes qui bloquaient Radarr :

2.  **Permissions** : J'ai corrigé les permissions du dossier sur l'hôte pour que Radarr puisse y écrire.
3.  **Profil de qualité** : J'ai mis à jour l'assistant pour utiliser le profil **HD-1080p** par défaut au lieu de la SD.

**Refaites le test :**
Envoyez "ajoute le film Inception". Cette fois, il devrait être ajouté avec succès ! 🎬

resultDisplay.originalContent:
import asyncio
import logging
import os
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OPENAI_API_KEY = os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY")
OPENAI_URL = "https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
async def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    logger.info(f"Searching for movie: {title}")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.get(search_url, timeout=15) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    error_text = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr HTTP {resp.status} : {error_text}")
                    return f"Erreur de communication avec Radarr (Code {resp.status})."
                
                results = await resp.json()
                if results and isinstance(results, list):
                    movie = results[0]
                    payload = {
                        "title": movie['title'], 
                        "qualityProfileId": 4, 
                        "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                        "images": movie['images'], 
                        "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], 
                        "year": movie['year'],
                        "rootFolderPath": "/movies", 
                        "monitored": True, 
                        "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
                    }
                    
                    add_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
                    async with session.post(add_url, json=payload, timeout=15) as post_resp:
                        if post_resp.status in [200, 201]:
                            logger.info(f"✅ Movie '{movie['title']}' added successfully.")
                            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
                        else:
                            post_err = await post_resp.text()
                            logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr POST {post_resp.status} : {post_err}")
                            return f"Erreur lors de l'ajout à Radarr (Code {post_resp.status})."
                
                return "❌ Film non trouvé."
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"❌ Exception Radarr : {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur technique Radarr : {e}"

# --- LOGIQUE IA (OpenAI) ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return await add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to OpenAI: {prompt[:50]}...")
    
    if not OPENAI_API_KEY:
        logger.error("OPENAI_API_KEY is not set.")
        return "❌ Erreur : Clé API OpenAI manquante."

    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {OPENAI_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }
    
    payload = {
        "model": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
    }

    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(OPENAI_URL, json=payload, headers=headers, timeout=30) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data["choices"][0]["message"]["content"]
                    logger.info("OpenAI response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_body = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"OpenAI error {resp.status}: {err_body}")
                    return f"❌ Erreur OpenAI : {resp.status}"
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"OpenAI connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion OpenAI : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)
resultDisplay.newContent:
import asyncio
import logging
import os
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OPENAI_API_KEY = os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY")
OPENAI_URL = "https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
async def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    logger.info(f"Searching for movie: {title}")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.get(search_url, timeout=15) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    error_text = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr HTTP {resp.status} : {error_text}")
                    return f"Erreur de communication avec Radarr (Code {resp.status})."
                
                results = await resp.json()
                if results and isinstance(results, list):
                    movie = results[0]
                    payload = {
                        "title": movie['title'], 
                        "qualityProfileId": 5, 
                        "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                        "images": movie['images'], 
                        "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], 
                        "year": movie['year'],
                        "rootFolderPath": "/movies", 
                        "monitored": True, 
                        "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
                    }
                    
                    add_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
                    async with session.post(add_url, json=payload, timeout=15) as post_resp:
                        if post_resp.status in [200, 201]:
                            logger.info(f"✅ Movie '{movie['title']}' added successfully.")
                            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
                        else:
                            post_err = await post_resp.text()
                            logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr POST {post_resp.status} : {post_err}")
                            return f"Erreur lors de l'ajout à Radarr (Code {post_resp.status})."
                
                return "❌ Film non trouvé."
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"❌ Exception Radarr : {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur technique Radarr : {e}"

# --- LOGIQUE IA (OpenAI) ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return await add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to OpenAI: {prompt[:50]}...")
    
    if not OPENAI_API_KEY:
        logger.error("OPENAI_API_KEY is not set.")
        return "❌ Erreur : Clé API OpenAI manquante."

    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {OPENAI_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }
    
    payload = {
        "model": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
    }

    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(OPENAI_URL, json=payload, headers=headers, timeout=30) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data["choices"][0]["message"]["content"]
                    logger.info("OpenAI response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_body = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"OpenAI error {resp.status}: {err_body}")
                    return f"❌ Erreur OpenAI : {resp.status}"
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"OpenAI connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion OpenAI : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)

toolCalls.description:
Replaces text within a file. By default, replaces a single occurrence, but can replace multiple occurrences when `expected_replacements` is specified. This tool requires providing significant context around the change to ensure precise targeting. Always use the read_file tool to examine the file's current content before attempting a text replacement.
      
      The user has the ability to modify the `new_string` content. If modified, this will be stated in the response.
      
      Expectation for required parameters:
      1. `old_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace (including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.).
      2. `new_string` MUST be the exact literal text to replace `old_string` with (also including all whitespace, indentation, newlines, and surrounding code etc.). Ensure the resulting code is correct and idiomatic and that `old_string` and `new_string` are different.
      3. `instruction` is the detailed instruction of what needs to be changed. It is important to Make it specific and detailed so developers or large language models can understand what needs to be changed and perform the changes on their own if necessary. 
      4. NEVER escape `old_string` or `new_string`, that would break the exact literal text requirement.
      **Important:** If ANY of the above are not satisfied, the tool will fail. CRITICAL for `old_string`: Must uniquely identify the single instance to change. Include at least 3 lines of context BEFORE and AFTER the target text, matching whitespace and indentation precisely. If this string matches multiple locations, or does not match exactly, the tool will fail.
      5. Prefer to break down complex and long changes into multiple smaller atomic calls to this tool. Always check the content of the file after changes or not finding a string to match.
      **Multiple replacements:** Set `expected_replacements` to the number of occurrences you want to replace. The tool will replace ALL occurrences that match `old_string` exactly. Ensure the number of replacements matches your expectation.

toolCalls.description:
This tool executes a given shell command as `bash -c <command>`. To run a command in the background, set the `is_background` parameter to true. Do NOT use `&` to background commands. Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

content.text:
adarr m'affiche des erreurs car il manque un client de téléchargement et des indexers. Nous allons compléter mon infrastructure média ('Arr stack').

Ajoute ces deux nouveaux services à mon fichier docker-compose.yml :

1. qBittorrent (Le client de téléchargement) :
Utilise l'image lscr.io/linuxserver/qbittorrent:latest.
Expose le port webui sur 8090:8080 (pour éviter les conflits) et le port torrent 6881:6881/tcp et udp.
Configure les volumes : ./data/qbittorrent/config:/config et surtout un volume partagé pour les films ./data/downloads:/downloads.
(Assure-toi que le volume /downloads est aussi monté dans le service radarr pour qu'il puisse voir les fichiers terminés !)

2. Prowlarr (Le gestionnaire d'Indexers) :
Utilise l'image lscr.io/linuxserver/prowlarr:latest.
Expose le port 9696:9696.
Configure le volume : ./data/prowlarr/config:/config.

Ajoute tout ça, vérifie que les volumes partagés entre Radarr et qBittorrent

services:
  # L'assistant IA (Python + FastAPI)
  open-claw:
    build: ./app
    container_name: open-claw
    depends_on:
      - ollama
    ports:
      - "5000:5000"
    environment:
      - OPENAI_API_KEY=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
    restart: always

  # Moteur IA (Ollama)
  ollama:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: ollama
    volumes:
      - ./data/ollama:/root/.ollama
    restart: always

  # Pont WhatsApp (Wuzapi - Go Lightweight)
  wuzapi:
    image: asternic/wuzapi:latest
    container_name: wuzapi
    ports:
      - "8081:8080" # On map sur le port 8081 en externe pour éviter les conflits

    volumes:

Command is executed as a subprocess that leads its own process group. Command process group can be terminated as `kill -- -PGID` or signaled as `kill -s SIGNAL -- -PGID`.

      Efficiency Guidelines:
      - Quiet Flags: Always prefer silent or quiet flags (e.g., `npm install --silent`, `git --no-pager`) to reduce output volume while still capturing necessary information.
      - Pagination: Always disable terminal pagination to ensure commands terminate (e.g., use `git --no-pager`, `systemctl --no-pager`, or set `PAGER=cat`).

      The following information is returned:

      Output: Combined stdout/stderr. Can be `(empty)` or partial on error and for any unwaited background processes.
      Exit Code: Only included if non-zero (command failed).
      Error: Only included if a process-level error occurred (e.g., spawn failure).
      Signal: Only included if process was terminated by a signal.
      Background PIDs: Only included if background processes were started.
      Process Group PGID: Only included if available.

resultDisplay.originalContent:
import asyncio
import logging
import os
from threading import Thread
import aiohttp
import requests
import schedule
import time
from fastapi import FastAPI, Request, BackgroundTasks

# --- CONFIGURATION ---
OPENAI_API_KEY = os.environ.get("OPENAI_API_KEY")
OPENAI_URL = "https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"
RADARR_URL = "http://gluetun:7878/api/v3"
RADARR_API_KEY = "67bc28f1dc6e45109e6f7b823424072f"
WUZAPI_URL = "http://wuzapi:8080"
WUZAPI_TOKEN = "jules_token_2026"
AUTHORIZED_NUMBER = "33663252842"

app = FastAPI()
logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger("assistant")

# --- OUTILS (RADARR) ---
async def add_movie_radarr(title):
    search_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie/lookup?term={title}&apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
    logger.info(f"Searching for movie: {title}")
    
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.get(search_url, timeout=15) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    error_text = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr HTTP {resp.status} : {error_text}")
                    return f"Erreur de communication avec Radarr (Code {resp.status})."
                
                results = await resp.json()
                if results and isinstance(results, list):
                    movie = results[0]
                    payload = {
                        "title": movie['title'], 
                        "qualityProfileId": 5, 
                        "titleSlug": movie['titleSlug'],
                        "images": movie['images'], 
                        "tmdbId": movie['tmdbId'], 
                        "year": movie['year'],
                        "rootFolderPath": "/movies", 
                        "monitored": True, 
                        "addOptions": {"searchForMovie": True}
                    }
                    
                    add_url = f"{RADARR_URL}/movie?apiKey={RADARR_API_KEY}"
                    async with session.post(add_url, json=payload, timeout=15) as post_resp:
                        if post_resp.status in [200, 201]:
                            logger.info(f"✅ Movie '{movie['title']}' added successfully.")
                            return f"✅ '{movie['title']}' ajouté à Radarr."
                        else:
                            post_err = await post_resp.text()
                            logger.error(f"❌ Erreur Radarr POST {post_resp.status} : {post_err}")
                            return f"Erreur lors de l'ajout à Radarr (Code {post_resp.status})."
                
                return "❌ Film non trouvé."
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"❌ Exception Radarr : {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur technique Radarr : {e}"

# --- LOGIQUE IA (OpenAI) ---
async def process_ai_logic(prompt: str):
    p = prompt.lower()
    if any(keyword in p for keyword in ["télécharge", "ajoute", "film"]):
        title = p.replace("télécharge", "").replace("ajoute", "").replace("le film", "").strip()
        return await add_movie_radarr(title)
    
    logger.info(f"Sending prompt to OpenAI: {prompt[:50]}...")
    
    if not OPENAI_API_KEY:
        logger.error("OPENAI_API_KEY is not set.")
        return "❌ Erreur : Clé API OpenAI manquante."

    headers = {
        "Authorization": f"Bearer {OPENAI_API_KEY}",
        "Content-Type": "application/json"
    }
    
    payload = {
        "model": "gpt-4o-mini",
        "messages": [{"role": "user", "content": prompt}]
    }

    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(OPENAI_URL, json=payload, headers=headers, timeout=30) as resp:
                if resp.status == 200:
                    data = await resp.json()
                    response_text = data["choices"][0]["message"]["content"]
                    logger.info("OpenAI response received.")
                    return response_text
                else:
                    err_body = await resp.text()
                    logger.error(f"OpenAI error {resp.status}: {err_body}")
                    return f"❌ Erreur OpenAI : {resp.status}"
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"OpenAI connection error: {e}")
        return f"❌ Erreur de connexion OpenAI : {e}"

# --- WHATSAPP (ENVOI via WuzAPI) ---
async def send_whatsapp(number, text):
    url = f"{WUZAPI_URL}/chat/send/text"
    headers = {"Token": WUZAPI_TOKEN, "Content-Type": "application/json"}
    clean_number = number.split('@')[0].split(':')[0]
    payload = {"phone": clean_number, "body": text}
    logger.info(f"Sending WhatsApp message to {clean_number}...")
    try:
        async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
            async with session.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers) as resp:
                if resp.status != 200:
                    logger.error(f"Failed to send message: {resp.status} - {await resp.text()}")
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Error sending WhatsApp message: {e}")

# --- WEBHOOK (RÉCEPTION via WuzAPI) ---
@app.post("/webhook")
async def webhook(request: Request, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks):
    try:
        data = await request.json()
    except Exception as e:
        logger.error(f"Failed to parse JSON: {e}")
        return {"status": "error"}

    if data.get("type") != "Message":
        return {"status": "ignored_event"}

    event = data.get("event")
    if not event and "jsonData" in data:
        import json
        event = json.loads(data["jsonData"]).get("event")

    if not event:
        return {"status": "no_data"}

    info = event.get("Info", {})
    sender = info.get("Sender") or info.get("Chat") or ""
    is_from_me = info.get("IsFromMe", False)

    # --- LISTE BLANCHE STRICTE ---
    if not (is_from_me or AUTHORIZED_NUMBER in sender):
        logger.info(f"Ignoring unauthorized message from {sender}")
        return {"status": "ignored_unauthorized"}

    msg_obj = event.get("Message", {})
    text = msg_obj.get("conversation") or \
           msg_obj.get("extendedTextMessage", {}).get("text")
    
    if text:
        logger.info(f"Processing authorized message from {sender}")
        background_tasks.add_task(handle_and_reply, sender, text)
            
    return {"status": "ok"}

async def handle_and_reply(sender, text):
    reply = await process_ai_logic(text)
    await send_whatsapp(sender, reply)

# --- SCHEDULER ---
def check_flights():
    print(f"[{time.ctime()}] Check vols : Pas de baisse de prix détectée.")

def run_scheduler():
    schedule.every().hour.do(check_flights)
    while True:
        schedule.run_pending()
        time.sleep(60)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    Thread(target=run_scheduler, daemon=True).start()
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=5000)
